publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-1649# Donald Gorrie: Commission on Sectarianism—That the Parliament believes that a commission composed of MSPs and well-informed people from outwith the parliament should be set up with a remit to examine and report on the extent of sectarian bigotry, discrimination and violence, on what useful action is already being taken to counter sectarianism and on what further measures the Parliament or the Scottish Executive should take, or persuade other bodies to take, to reduce this blot on Scottish society.
S1M-1649# Commission on Sectarianism (lodged on 12 February 2001) Dennis Canavan*, Mr John McAllion*

S1M-1649# Donald Gorrie: Commission on Sectarianism—That the Parliament believes that a commission composed of MSPs and well-informed people from outwith the parliament should be set up with a remit to examine and report on the extent of sectarian bigotry, discrimination and violence, on what useful action is already being taken to counter sectarianism and on what further measures the Parliament or the Scottish Executive should take, or persuade other bodies to take, to reduce this blot on Scottish society. Supported by: Dennis Canavan, Mr John McAllion

S1M-1649# Donald Gorrie: Commission on Sectarianism—That the Parliament believes that a commission composed of MSPs and well-informed people from outwith the parliament should be set up with a remit to examine and report on the extent of sectarian bigotry, discrimination and violence, on what useful action is already being taken to counter sectarianism and on what further measures the Parliament or the Scottish Executive should take, or persuade other bodies to take, to reduce this blot on Scottish society. Supported by: Dennis Canavan, Mr John McAllion, Mr Lloyd Quinan*
S1M-1649# Commission on Sectarianism (lodged on 12 February 2001) Nora Radcliffe*

S1M-1649# Donald Gorrie: Commission on Sectarianism—That the Parliament believes that a commission composed of MSPs and well-informed people from outwith the parliament should be set up with a remit to examine and report on the extent of sectarian bigotry, discrimination and violence, on what useful action is already being taken to counter sectarianism and on what further measures the Parliament or the Scottish Executive should take, or persuade other bodies to take, to reduce this blot on Scottish society. Supported by: Dennis Canavan, Mr John McAllion, Mr Lloyd Quinan, Nora Radcliffe

S1M-1649# Donald Gorrie: Commission on Sectarianism—That the Parliament believes that a commission composed of MSPs and well-informed people from outwith the parliament should be set up with a remit to examine and report on the extent of sectarian bigotry, discrimination and violence, on what useful action is already being taken to counter sectarianism and on what further measures the Parliament or the Scottish Executive should take, or persuade other bodies to take, to reduce this blot on Scottish society. Supported by: Dennis Canavan, Mr John McAllion, Mr Lloyd Quinan, Nora Radcliffe

S1M-1649# Donald Gorrie: Commission on Sectarianism—That the Parliament believes that a commission composed of MSPs and well-informed people from outwith the parliament should be set up with a remit to examine and report on the extent of sectarian bigotry, discrimination and violence, on what useful action is already being taken to counter sectarianism and on what further measures the Parliament or the Scottish Executive should take, or persuade other bodies to take, to reduce this blot on Scottish society. Supported by: Dennis Canavan, Mr John McAllion, Mr Lloyd Quinan, Nora Radcliffe

S1M-1649# Donald Gorrie: Commission on Sectarianism—That the Parliament believes that a commission composed of MSPs and well-informed people from outwith the parliament should be set up with a remit to examine and report on the extent of sectarian bigotry, discrimination and violence, on what useful action is already being taken to counter sectarianism and on what further measures the Parliament or the Scottish Executive should take, or persuade other bodies to take, to reduce this blot on Scottish society. Supported by: Dennis Canavan, Mr John McAllion, Mr Lloyd Quinan, Nora Radcliffe

S1M-1649# Donald Gorrie: Commission on Sectarianism—That the Parliament believes that a commission composed of MSPs and well-informed people from outwith the parliament should be set up with a remit to examine and report on the extent of sectarian bigotry, discrimination and violence, on what useful action is already being taken to counter sectarianism and on what further measures the Parliament or the Scottish Executive should take, or persuade other bodies to take, to reduce this blot on Scottish society. Supported by: Dennis Canavan, Mr John McAllion, Mr Lloyd Quinan, Nora Radcliffe
